pros: Great people, atmosphere, and learning experience

review_title: Research assistant for the Clinic Center

pros: Good schedule, nice people in the library, can be very interesting work.
cons: Administration transparency is flawed, pay is mediocre, raises are nonexistent.

review_title: Faculty & Staff are great! Most administrators are not!
pros: Faculty and staff are some of the best co-workers. A few of the deans, too.
cons: A few of the deans have their own little "clique" and will lie to protect themselves and each other. Mean girls of the school. Will lie about other coworkers and will definitely lie about students.

pros: Vacation time, dress code and on campus programs were very good. Hours and overall physical work environment very good.
cons: Pay structure for administrative staff extremely low. Paying to park is outlandish Definite "us" and "them" attitude held by attorney staff, many who had not worked outside of either academia or government-held position for a number of years. Accordingly, their view on how things really work in a law firm was totally out of touch. Conservative views not at all welcome. Students being brainwashed into liberal thinking. Absolutely disgraceful.

review_title: Great people to work with along with meaningful work.
job_title: Post Graduate Fellow in East Greenbush, NY
pros: People, passion, and meaningful work being done. Also great networking opportunities are available.
cons: Salary is not super competitive.  While you can make more at a law firm this job pays more than many fellowships.

pros: Everyone is nice and working at library is flexible.
